alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 10 at 10:57AM EST until March 15 at 6:15PM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale. East Fork White River near Bedford. East Fork White River at Williams. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Indiana... Driftwood River near Edinburgh. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River at Seymour. .Ongoing flooding will continue along portions of the East Fork White, White, and Wabash Rivers and their tributaries. River stages are rising again due to previous rainfall over the weekend. Minor flooding is largely expected, which primarily impacts river roads, parks, and agricultural land. The crest on the Wabash River is between Lafayette and Covington. The crest on the White River is near Spencer. The crest on the East Fork White River is between Seymour and Rivervale. New precipitation amounts through the weekend will not impact current flooding. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River near Rivervale. * WHEN...Until Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 25.0 feet, All county roads across or located in the East Fork White River flood plain flood. Flooding of agricultural land becomes extensive. The county road on northside of gage floods and gage may be inaccessible except by boat. Local residents in nearby river cabins must park on higher grounds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Thursday the stage was 23.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Thursday was 23.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.1 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
